result.execSummary:
The defendant Chavierr L. Kirkman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. 
**Pay supervision fees.**
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
**Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.**
**If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
**Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chavierr L. Kirkman

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Zachary Brost appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Kristian Nordby.  Clerk: PU
 Minutes:  DE pleads Guilty on all 3 counts; found guilty by the Court. DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 12 months with conditions.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights given.

records.addlTxt: Defendant, Chavierr L. Kirkman, appeared with Attorney KRISTIAN V NORDBY.  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  ST called witness KPD Ofc Albert Gonzales; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Nordby. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. DE requests substitution of Br 3; Br 4 assigned.  Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
DE requests substitution of Br 3; Br 4 assigned.
